come.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to move towards you or arrive at the place where you are
come.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Let me know when they come.
Can you come here for a minute?
Come a bit closer and you’ll be able to see better.
What time will you be coming home?
Jess came flying round the corner and banged straight into me.
come running/flying/speeding etc
What day are your folks coming to dinner?
come to dinner/lunch
Ah, here comes the bus at last!
here comes somebody/something
There was a knock on the door and a young woman came into the room.
come in/into/out of etc
I could see a figure coming towards me.
come to/towards
As they came down the track, the car skidded.
come across/down/up etc
I’ve come to see Philip.
come to do something
I’ll come and help you move the rest of the boxes.
come and do something
Come and look at this!
come and do something
come.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if someone comes with you, they go to a place with you
come.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: We’re going for a drink this evening. Would you like to come?
I asked Rosie if she’d like to come with us.
It should be good fun. Why don’t you come along?
come.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to travel to or reach a place
come.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Have you come far (=travelled a long way) today?
I’ve come a long way to see you.
Will you be coming by train?
Some of the birds have come thousands of miles to winter here.
They came over the mountains in the north.
Legend has it that the tribe came from across the Pacific Ocean.
come.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if a letter etc comes, it is delivered to you by post
come.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: A letter came for you this morning.
The phone bill hasn’t come yet.
come.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if a time or an event comes, it arrives or happens
come.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: At last the day came for us to set off.
The moment had come for me to break the news to her.
The time will come when you’ll thank me for this.
Christmas seems to come earlier every year.
I knew he’d be able to take care of himself, come what may (=whatever happens).
The most exciting part is yet to come.
come.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to reach a particular level or place
come.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: She had blonde hair which came down to her waist.
The water came up as far as my chest.
come.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to be produced or sold with particular features
come.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: This particular sofa comes in four different colours.
Cats come in many shapes and sizes.
The computer comes complete with software and games.
come.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: to be in a particular position in an order, a series, or a list
come.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: She came first in the 200 metres.
P comes before Q in the alphabet.
come.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a man’s semen (=the liquid he produces during sex)
